examples: Now that I know it's taken care of, I can rest easy at night.
labels: now rare except in certain expressions
definitions.label_groups: now rare except in certain expressions

examples: It's often easy to wake up but hard to get up.
The teacher gave an easy test to her students.

definitions.definition: Causing ease; giving comfort, or freedom from care or labour.
examples: Rich people live in easy circumstances.

definitions.definition: Free from constraint, harshness, or formality; unconstrained; smooth.

examples: She has a reputation for being easy ; they say she slept with half the senior class.

definitions.definition: Not making resistance or showing unwillingness; tractable; yielding; compliant.
Not straitened as to money matters; opposed to tight .

main_definition: ( now rare except in certain expressions ) Comfortable ; at ease .
secondary_definitions: Causing ease; giving comfort, or freedom from care or labour.
Free from constraint, harshness, or formality; unconstrained; smooth.
( informal , derogatory , of a woman ) Consenting readily to sex .
Not making resistance or showing unwillingness; tractable; yielding; compliant.
( finance , dated ) Not straitened as to money matters; opposed to tight .
